definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She keeps after her boyfriend all day long and he can't bear it any more.
sentences.chinese: 她整天都在與她的男朋友爭吵，他沒法再忍受下去了。

sentences.english: After a hot argument， she wrote off her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 她和男朋友大吵了一架之後，就把他甩了。

sentences.english: I didn't like the film much but my boyfriend went into raptures about it.
sentences.chinese: 我不太喜歡那部電影，但我的男朋友卻對它了迷。

sentences.english: I wish she stop blabbering her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我希望她停止碟碟不休地談論她男朋友。

sentences.english: Some girls are coaxed into it by boy friends, or lure into it by predators.
sentences.chinese: 有些女孩這麼做或受男朋友哄騙，或受獵豔者引誘。

sentences.english: My boyfriend have ever sweared to love me forever.
sentences.chinese: 我男朋友曾發誓說永遠愛我。
喬安娜的男朋友是個木工。

sentences.english: This young man's name is Lu Yan. He is Shen Hongmei's boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 這位小夥子叫呂岩，他是沈紅梅的男朋友。

sentences.english: It was the first time for Sally to meet her boyfriend at a party.
sentences.chinese: 莎莉第一次遇見她的男朋友是在一個聚會上。

sentences.english: Today, I met my boyfriend's notoriously difficult mother.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我見到了男朋友那人稱鬼見愁的老媽。

sentences.english: That's forced the guys to be better boyfriends in turn.
sentences.chinese: 這逼迫了男人們成爲了更好的男朋友。

sentences.english: Her boyfriend had left her, and she was in great pain.
sentences.chinese: 她男朋友離她而去，使她痛苦萬分。

sentences.english: Kate's new boyfriend is a very couth youth.
sentences.chinese: 凱特的新男朋友是一個很有教養的年輕人。

sentences.english: You can't imagine. Her new boyfriend is a nit-picking lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 你無法想象，她的男朋友是一個吹毛求疵的律師。

sentences.english: But it's, I, no one ever has any luck finding a boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 但我，沒人有運氣找到男朋友。

definition: (coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to part company/to split up/to break up
older female cousin via female line
